title: Hot Stove: Sign on the dotted line
subtitle: Hot Stove: Signing day
body: It was a big bookkeeping day for baseball. Approaching the deadline for teams and arbitration-eligible players to exchange salary figures, many simply exchanged signatures.  By early evening, after a day of typical whirlwind negotiations, a total of 38 players had avoided arbitration by reaching contract agreements with their clubs on Tuesday. That activity reduced to 43 the number of players still in the process.  The big winner in terms of contract length was Washington catcher Brian Schneider, who signed a four-year, $16 million contract. The thinnest spread? Tampa Bay reliever Travis Harper asked for $900,000 and was offered $800,000.         Tom Singer is a reporter for MLB.com This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Tom Singer
